column4: hi, anyone knows where the defualt ubuntu iptable config is stored ?
no default setting afaik
check current rules by sudo iptables -L
seems empty
so you have no rules at all
seems weirdo to me to have it running with no rules
but on the default install ..
try firestarter or ufw
ufw ?
ubuntu default firewall, there is also a simple GUI for it: gufw
firestart gives some weirdo error saying that the inerface isn t ready,
check prefrences for local and internet interfaces.  btw, firestarter is a dead project, try something else
cool  that s  a goood simple soft
is there a way i can see the blocked connection or troggered loggings?
it is designed to be simple and powerfull, enjoy :)
not sure aboyt logging, look /var/log/ for something familiar
it s  rather primitive compared to a direct access to iptable , but i don t feells like messign with iptable for my home computer
thanks a lot , i have a static ip since yesterday, in the 5 min  installed ufw i already got some weidro connections blocked
just configured it to block incoming connections that was enought :)
cool, since i am behind a linksys router, i dont play around local firewalls, but should try UFW once :)
you know if there s a default profile for apparmor or if there s a  guyi for it as well ?
afaik, there is no gui for apparmor, and i am not much into its rules/configs
